summary: Wolverton Viaduct is a big bridge in England that carries trains over a river. Built in 1838 by Robert Stephenson, it's one of the largest on the West Coast Main Line. The viaduct has six arches, is 660 feet long, and stands 57 feet high. It was widened in the 1880s to accommodate more tracks. Despite some construction challenges, it's still standing strong and is considered a historically important structure.
title: Wolverton Viaduct
